cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 485 mi southwest of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: gradually bending WNW on Friday then NW through the weekend, aiming toward northern Baja California and the northern Gulf of California early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Baja California Peninsula (just south of the U.S.–Mexico border)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Surf currently impacting southwest Mexico and southern Baja; storm expected to affect the entire Baja California coastline and possibly far SW Arizona/Southern California late weekend–Monday.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm force winds; breezy/gusty conditions more likely than damaging winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for San Diego due to large distance and weakening trend before any approach.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Rosa could bring periods of heavy showers with local totals 1–3 inches Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents possible along Southern California beaches early next week.
